channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Did Venezuela's Delcy Rodríguez cut a deal with Trump before Maduro’s capture?
Republic Day 2026: Meet the founding mothers of the Indian Constitution
Who is Adam Presser, the CEO of TikTok's US joint venture?
Andhra horror: How a woman killed husband, watched porn beside the body
How Davos, and Trump, turned Canada’s banker PM Carney into a global political star
Will Shehbaz Sharif be forced to withdraw Pakistan from Trump’s Board of Peace?
Trump’s Board of Peace for Gaza: India’s strategic choices in a fading UN order
item.description: For India, the best option is to take cues from other major powers, and there is no need to bend too far forward or backward. Anything that brings global peace and allows free trade is desirable

item.title: Why India-EU trade pact is ‘Mother of All Deals’
item.description: Once the EU-India free trade agreement becomes a reality, the Americans will be keen to proceed with the India-US interim trade deal at the earliest too

item.title: How chaos came to Trump many certainties in the world
item.description: Donald Trump did not invent the chaotic style of leadership. But he dragged it back into the open, platformed it, stripped it of its subtlety, amplified it through social media, and made it the official gospel of the most powerful nation-state in the world

item.title: Iran is not fighting for liberalism: How feminism is misreading the moment
item.description: The future Iranian woman is not a liberal mascot or a religious subject. She is a political adult refusing to be managed. That is what frightens the clerical state

item.title: The Donroe Doctrine: How Trump’s Greenland gambit signals return of US imperialism
item.description: From Venezuela to Greenland, Washington’s new strongman diplomacy is reshaping global power politics, and India must watch closely

item.title: When Canada looks east: Carney reaches out to China amid Trump’s tantrums
item.description: For much of the past decade, Canada’s China policy has been constrained by its deep economic and security integration with the United States. Donald Trump’s policies have upended that.
